hivis.data.reader

Class SpreadSheetReader

  • java.lang.Object
    • hivis.data.reader.SpreadSheetReader
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    DataSetSource<DataTable>

    public class SpreadSheetReader
extends Object
implements DataSetSource<DataTable>
    Class to read data from a spreadsheet file. The data is presented as a DataTable. The DataTable is automatically updated when the file changes. Currently Excel (xlsx) and CSV-like files are supported. TODO Currently columns in the sheet are read as DataSeries. Add support for row-based format.
    Author:
    O. J. Coleman

      Defines the configuration for a SpreadSheetReader.

    • Constructor Detail

      • SpreadSheetReader

        public SpreadSheetReader(File file)

        Load data from the specified file.

        If the first row contains all strings, except one column at most, then it is used as the header row.

        The generated DataTable will be updated in real time as changes are saved to the file.

        DataSeries are created to match the data type for a column (using the first non-empty data element of a column):

        Numeric:
        DataSeries<Double>.
        Date:
        DataSeries<TemporalAccessor> (for columns formatted as dates/times (Excel), or text that looks like an ISO-like date or time (CSV).
        String:
        DataSeries<String> (for everything else).

        Parameters:
        file - The spreadsheet file.

      • SpreadSheetReader

        public SpreadSheetReader(File file,
                         int sheet,
                         int headerRow,
                         int firstDataRow,
                         int firstDataColumn)
        Deprecated. As of 2.0. Superseded by SpreadSheetReader(hivis.data.reader.SpreadSheetReader.Config). This constructor will be removed in future releases.
        Create a new SpreadSheetReader that reads data from the specified file and sheet, with data beginning at the specified row and column. Numeric series will be created as DataSeries<Double>.
        Parameters:
        file - The spreadsheet file.
        sheet - The zero-based index of the sheet in the spreadsheet to read from (if applicable).
        headerRow - The zero-based index of the row to use as column headers, or -1 for no header row.
        firstDataRow - The zero-based index of the row to start reading data from (to the end of the sheet).
        firstDataColumn - The zero-based index of the column to start creating series from (up to the last column).

      • SpreadSheetReader

        public SpreadSheetReader(File file,
                         int sheet,
                         int headerRow,
                         int firstDataRow,
                         int firstDataColumn,
                         boolean doublePrecision)
        Deprecated. As of 2.0. Superseded by SpreadSheetReader(hivis.data.reader.SpreadSheetReader.Config). This constructor will be removed in future releases.
        Create a new SpreadSheetReader that reads data from the specified file and sheet, with data beginning at the specified row and column.
        Parameters:
        file - The spreadsheet file.
        sheet - The zero-based index of the sheet in the spreadsheet to read from (if applicable).
        headerRow - The zero-based index of the row to use as column headers, or -1 for no header row.
        firstDataRow - The zero-based index of the row to start reading data from (to the end of the sheet).
        firstDataColumn - The zero-based index of the column to start creating series from (up to the last column).
        doublePrecision - If true then numeric series will be created as DataSeries<Double>, otherwise they will be created as DataSeries<Float>.

      • SpreadSheetReader

        public SpreadSheetReader(SpreadSheetReader.Config config)

        Load data from a file using the given configuration.

        The generated DataTable will be updated in real time as changes are saved to the file.

        DataSeries are created to match the data type for a column (using the first non-empty data element of a column):

        Numeric:
        DataSeries<Double/Float> (see SpreadSheetReader.Config.doublePrecision(boolean).
        Date:
        DataSeries<TemporalAccessor/Date> (for columns formatted as dates/times (Excel), or text that looks like an ISO-like date or time (CSV). See SpreadSheetReader.Config.useDeprecatedDates(boolean)).
        String:
        DataSeries<String> (for everything else).
        Parameters:
        config - The configuration describing how to read and process the spreadsheet.
